description: Validate the core research-sites workflow produces correct, structured output.

tests.name: Per-Page Component Table
tests.prompt: Research components for a landing page
expectations: Output contains a `## Landing Page` section
Table has columns: #, Section, Component, Style, Link, Complexity
Table contains at least 3 rows covering different sections (hero, nav, features, etc.)
Each row has a non-empty value in every column
Below the table, numbered descriptions explain each component
tests.pass_criteria: Table renders valid markdown with no empty cells.

tests.name: Direct URL Links
expectations: Every Link cell contains a markdown link: `[Source](https://full-url)`
Links point to specific component pages, not site homepages
Good: `[Aceternity](https://ui.aceternity.com/components/floating-dock)`
Bad: `[Aceternity](https://ui.aceternity.com)`
All URLs are reachable HTTPS links
tests.pass_criteria: Zero homepage-only links. All links contain a path beyond the domain.
fail_indicators: Links without a path beyond the domain

tests.name: Multiple Sources
expectations: Results include components from at least 3 different sources
Sources drawn from: 21st.dev, Aceternity, Magic UI, Origin UI, shadcn, Godly
No single source dominates more than 50% of results
Source names match the actual site (not fabricated)
tests.pass_criteria: >= 3 distinct source domains across the table.
fail_indicators: Single source dominates more than 50% of results

tests.name: Per-Page Organization
tests.prompt: Research all pages (landing, dashboard, auth, billing)
expectations: Output has 4 separate `## [Page] Page` sections
Each section has its own table with independent numbering starting at 1
Sections cover page-appropriate components (hero for landing, sidebar for dashboard)
Ends with the pick prompt: "Pick numbers to implement..."
No mixing of page types within a single table
tests.pass_criteria: 4 distinct sections, each with own table, correct section types.
fail_indicators: Mixed page types in a single table
Missing pick prompt at the end

tests.name: Complexity and Style Labels
expectations: Complexity column uses only: Simple, Medium, Advanced
Style column uses labels from the defined set (Glassmorphism, Aurora, Parallax, etc.)
Simple = CSS-only or <50 lines; Medium = hooks/animation 50-150; Advanced = 150+
No invented complexity levels or unlabeled entries
tests.pass_criteria: All rows use valid complexity and style labels.
fail_indicators: Unlabeled entries in complexity or style columns
